page.title: 02 New Town Pioneers
page.content: Early memories of Stevenage New Town. "I've lived in this house 29 years.We were the first to live in it.I thought it was lovely. We lived in a small flat before with no garden.We didn't have any pavements .The garden was full of bricks,stones and sand left over from the builders, so we had a big job clearing it up."..."Mud-there was mud everywhere!The only shops were in the old town where the shop keepers were not very friendly,most resented us. The first shops were at Rockingham Way. Before that there was one mobile grocer.Also there were no schools for the new town.I had to go to St.Nicholas the old church school.It was cold and we used to sit round the fire.I have lived in Stevenage for 32 years and have seen it grow into a caring community with very good facilities."
